title: Discharge of Debtor After Completion of Chapter 13 plan
question: Got a letter from United States Bankruptcy court , Tittled Discharge of Debtor After Completion of Chapter 13 plan , reads the following ... It appearing that the debtor is entitled to a discharge
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy court,Chapter 13 bankruptcy,Credit,Chapter 13 bankruptcy repayment plan,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Chapter 13 bankruptcy reorganization plan
answers: Chapter 13 is a difficult process and has a high failure rate. You have completed all the requirements to receives your discharge and the case is now over. Congratulations!
Yes ... that is your formal Discharge letter. You are done.
Congratulations on completing the Chapter 13 bankruptcy.
You have been granted a discharge upon successful completion of your payment plan.

Congratulations! You received the actual discharge order. The Chapter 13 is now complete.

Contact your lawyer and review your credit reports to make sure your debts are being reported correctly.
